description:
Apple Introduces iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08
Major New Versions of iPhoto & iMovie

CUPERTINO, CaliforniaÃƒÂ¢??August 7, 2007ÃƒÂ¢??AppleÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® today introduced iLifeÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® ÃƒÂ¢??08, the most significant upgrade ever to AppleÃƒÂ¢??s award-winning suite of digital lifestyle applications, featuring a major new version of iPhotoÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® and a completely reinvented iMovieÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â®. iPhoto ÃƒÂ¢??08 automatically organizes photo libraries into Events that let users more easily manage their growing photo collections, and iMovie ÃƒÂ¢??08 introduces an entirely new way for users to quickly make movies and share them online. Both iPhoto and iMovie integrate seamlessly with the new .Mac Web Gallery, AppleÃƒÂ¢??s new service for .Mac members to instantly create and host stunning online websites for their photos and videos. iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08 also features iWebÃƒÂ¢?Ã‚Â¢ ÃƒÂ¢??08, with live web widgets such as Google Maps that let users create even more dynamic websites, and GarageBandÃƒÂ¢?Ã‚Â¢ ÃƒÂ¢??08, with its new Magic GarageBand feature that makes it fun and easy for both musicians and non-musicians to create great sounding songs.

ÃƒÂ¢??Apple has taken iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08 to a new level that is years ahead of anything available for the PC,ÃƒÂ¢?? said Steve Jobs, AppleÃƒÂ¢??s CEO. ÃƒÂ¢??We think iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08 gives Mac users even more reasons to love their Macs, and PC users even more reasons to switch.ÃƒÂ¢??

iPhoto ÃƒÂ¢??08 automatically groups all photos into Events, each containing a dayÃƒÂ¢??s worth of photos represented by a single picture. Users can simply move their mouse over an Event to instantly ÃƒÂ¢??skimÃƒÂ¢?? through all its photos. Users can split a single dayÃƒÂ¢??s event into multiple events, such as a birthday party in the morning and a wedding in the evening, or merge events on multiple days into a single event, such as a weekend ski vacation. Users can hide photos they donÃƒÂ¢??t want to see every day but donÃƒÂ¢??t want to throw away, and a unified search allows users to instantly find all their photos across all Events by rating, date and keywords. Users can produce frame-worthy prints on a home printer with new Apple-designed photo themes, and order keepsake books with customizable dust jackets and professional quality hardcovers with elegant foil printing, new spiral-bound softcover books that can be laid flat for easy viewing, or new larger wall calendars.

With iMovie ÃƒÂ¢??08, AppleÃƒÂ¢??s movie-making software has been completely reinvented to let users rediscover and enjoy their video library, make movies in minutes instead of hours, and share their movies with family, friends or the entire world in a snap. iMovie ÃƒÂ¢??08 can import video from the latest AVCHD, HDV and DV camcorders, as well as from digital cameras, and displays a userÃƒÂ¢??s entire video library whether itÃƒÂ¢??s stored on internal or external drives. Users can preview any of their video clips by simply moving their mouse over the clip to ÃƒÂ¢??skimÃƒÂ¢?? through it forward or backward at any speed, including faster than real time. Users can select video as easily as selecting text, make a movie by simply dragging the selected video into a project, then easily add a soundtrack from iTunesÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â®, voiceovers, and elegant effects and cinematic titles. iMovie ÃƒÂ¢??08 makes it as easy as a few clicks to enjoy your movies on an iPodÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â®, iPhoneÃƒÂ¢?Ã‚Â¢ or Apple TVÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â®, or share with the entire world on YouTube.

For .Mac members, Apple is also introducing the stunning .Mac Web Gallery. .Mac Web Gallery is fully integrated with iPhoto ÃƒÂ¢??08 and iMovie ÃƒÂ¢??08, letting users share their photos and movies on the web with just a few clicks. .Mac Web Gallery automatically builds a website containing photo galleries and movies that can be viewed on any modern computer or iPhone. Photos can be downloaded to print at sizes up to 16x20, and movies can be viewed at higher-than-DVD resolution.

iWeb ÃƒÂ¢??08 offers new features to make websites more interactive by adding live web widgets such as Google Maps, targeted ads using Google AdSense and photos or movies from .Mac Web Galleries. Users can also add Internet video, news headlines, weather and more from any site that supports HTML snippets. A new ÃƒÂ¢??My AlbumÃƒÂ¢?? page template lets users easily organize photo albums and videos into one simple index web page. The new iWeb includes a range of beautiful new Apple-designed themes that users can change at any time to experiment with different web page designs, even after their site has been published. With a .Mac membership, users can also now host iWeb websites using their own personal domains.

GarageBand ÃƒÂ¢??08 introduces Magic GarageBand, an easy and fun way for musicians and non-musicians alike to create a song. Users can pick from nine musical genres and interact with a band of ÃƒÂ¢??playersÃƒÂ¢?? on a virtual stage by selecting an instrument and musical part for each player to create thousands of possible song combinations. Users can play along with a built-in software instrument or record their voice to sing along to their own music. The new GarageBand also offers powerful new features for more advanced musicians, including multi-take recording to capture the best performance, arrangements to cut, copy and paste intros, verses and choruses, and support for 24-bit audio interfaces.

Pricing & Availability
iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08 is now available for a suggested retail price of $79 (US) through the Apple StoreÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® (www.apple.com), AppleÃƒÂ¢??s retail stores and Apple Authorized Resellers. The iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08 suite of applications will be included with all new Macs beginning today. .Mac is available as a subscription-based service for $99.95 (US) per year for individuals and $179.95 (US) for a Family Pack which includes one master account and four sub accounts. Anyone can sign up for a free, 60-day .Mac trial from www.mac.com.*

iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08 requires Mac OSÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® X version 10.4.9 or later, a MacintoshÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® computer with an Intel processor, a PowerPC G5 or PowerPC G4, QuickTimeÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® 7.2 or later, a DVD drive for installation and 3GB of available disk space. iPhoto print services are available in the US, Canada, Japan and select European countries. A .Mac account is recommended for iWeb. Full system requirements and more information on iLife ÃƒÂ¢??08 can be found at www.apple.com/ilife.
